settings.question: What is the difference between pharmaceutical and organic anti-inflammatory supplements?
settings.answer_body1: Natural anti-inflammatory supplements can help the body fight pain and inflammation with natural ingredients like turmeric, fish oils and MSM. These are extremely accessible and effective anti-inflammatory supplements for joints. Pharmaceuticals are compounds prescribed by medical doctors.

settings.question: Do anti-inflammatory supplements help treat chronic inflammation?
settings.answer_body1: Natural remedies for back pain and chronic inflammation can act as a treatment and maintenance. These can even be supplements for brain inflammation. Anti-inflammatory natural remedies can be a wonderful way to naturally help with chronic and on-going issues without any side effects. Glucosamine and chondroitin are great anti-inflammatory supplements for joints.

settings.question: Do anti-inflammatory supplements help treat conditions like tendonitis?
settings.answer_body1: Inflammation associated with tendonitis is often one of the first signs of the irritation of the tendons themselves. A natural remedy and treatment for tendonitis inflammation for arthritis is humic fluid acid, derived from ancient fossilized tropical vegetation. It is one of the safest and best supplements for reducing inflammation and a great option for a natural supplement for arthritis and tendonitis when taking prescription medication. settings.question: What is the best natural anti-inflammatory supplement?
settings.answer_body1: The best natural anti-inflammatory supplements will vary depending on the person and the condition being treated. A combination of Hyaluronic Acid and Turmeric or Boswellia is one of the most commonly used, but all anti-inflammatory supplements should be cleared with your physician or pharmacist to be used in conjunction with other medications.

settings.question: What is the fastest way to reduce inflammation in the body?
settings.answer_body1: The Well Well Well range of natural anti-inflammatory supplements including collagen, turmeric and Omega 3 fatty acids are the most commonly used to fight inflammation as they work by boosting naturally occurring anti-inflammatory compounds already contained within your body.

settings.question: What supplements help with anti-inflammatory issues?
settings.answer_body1: Turmeric, Methylsulfonylmethane (MSM), Glucosamine, Bosweilla, Serrapeptase, and fatty acid are all anti-inflammatory supplements in our range that can be used to help with pain and inflammation.

settings.question: What are the worst foods for inflammation?
settings.answer_body1: Foods that can worsen inflammation include caffeine, processed foods, saturated and trans fats, refined sugars and carbohydrates, alcohol and Casein (found in most dairy products). When taking anti-inflammatory herbs and supplements, it is recommended that these foods should be drastically reduced or removed from your diet altogether.
